data.name: Quick Characters
entries: Sometimes you need quick characters for a D&D session. Whether you're running an impromptu game with limited time for character creation, you want to get a new player into an established game quickly, or you need a new PC to replace a dead adventurer, these optional rules are for you. These rules can be used instead of the normal process of character creation, replacing the choice and creativity of that process with a series of tables that quickly generate a 1st-level character.
With the exception of backgrounds, these rules focus on the character options available in the D&D Basic Rules as a means of keeping things simple.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Roll a {@dice d6} to determine your character's alignment.

entries.name: Background
entries: Backgrounds already make use of random tables to flesh out your character, and are easy to apply. You can roll a {@dice d6} to determine your character's background if you're using the Basic Rules, or roll a {@dice d20} to use the full list of backgrounds from the Player's Handbook.

Alternatively, for players who are comfortable defining a character's personality traits, ideals, bonds, and flaws through roleplaying, the quick character generation process can be made even quicker by foregoing a background, instead rolling for the skill and tool proficiencies normally provided by a background. Roll four times on the following table, rerolling any duplicate results.

In place of a background feature, once during any game session, you can pick a nonplayer character you meet and declare that your character knows that NPC. The relationship is respectful but not necessarily friendly. The DM determines the exact nature of your relationship.

entries.name: Class and Abilities
entries: Roll a {@dice d6} to determine your class from the following table, which is more likely to generate a fighter or cleric than a rogue or wizard. Especially if you're randomly generating an entire party, tilting the odds in favor of fighters and clerics can help shore up a group's ability to survive in combat. Alternatively (or if you're generating a single character joining an already balanced party), you can roll a {@dice d4} and give each class an equal chance of being generated.

When determining your ability scores, your choice of class shapes which abilities are of most use to your character. Roll a {@dice d6} to determine the ability score array your character uses. Then assign those numbers to your abilities in an order determined by your class.

entries.name: Cleric
entries: Wisdom, Strength, Constitution, Charisma, Dexterity, Intelligence.

entries.name: Fighter
entries: Strength, Constitution, Dexterity, Wisdom, Intelligence, Charisma.

entries.name: Rogue
entries: Dexterity, Charisma, Intelligence, Constitution, Strength, Wisdom.

entries.name: Wizard
entries: Intelligence, Dexterity, Wisdom, Charisma, Constitution, Strength.

For example, a player creating a cleric rolls a 4 for the character's ability score array—16, 12, 12, 12, 10, and 8. Those numbers are assigned in that order to the ability scores listed for clerics, yielding a character with Strength 12, Dexterity 10, Constitution 12, Intelligence 8, Wisdom 16, and Charisma 12.
After you assign your character's ability scores, but before applying any modifiers for your race (see below), you can swap any two scores.

entries.name: Equipment
entries: Your class also determines your equipment. Select gear from your class's quick equipment choices, except for any of the prebuilt packs such as the explorer's pack or the priest's pack (see below). Alternatively, you can select one of the following default equipment packages:

items.name: Cleric:
items.entry: {@item Mace|phb}, {@item scale mail|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb} and 20 {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|bolts}, {@item shield|phb}, {@item holy symbol|phb}

items.name: Fighter:
items.entry: {@item Chain mail|phb}, {@item longsword|phb}, {@item shield|phb}, {@item light crossbow|phb} and 20 {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|bolts}

items.name: Rogue:
items.entry: {@item Shortsword|phb}, {@item shortbow|phb} and 20 {@item Arrows (20)|PHB|arrows}, {@item leather armor|phb}, two {@item dagger|phb|daggers}, {@item thieves' tools|phb}

entries: Then select one of the following standard equipment packs for your character:

items: {@item Backpack|phb}, {@item sack|phb}, {@item bullseye lantern|phb|lantern}, 2 {@item oil (flask)|phb|oil flasks}, {@item tinderbox|phb}, 12 {@item piton|phb|pitons}, {@item hammer|phb}, {@item waterskin|phb}, {@item rations (1 day)|phb|rations} (4 days), 5 gp

{@item Backpack|phb}, 2 {@item sack|phb|sacks}, 6 {@item torch|phb|torches}, 3 {@item oil (flask)|phb|oil flasks}, {@item tinderbox|phb}, {@item Pole (10-foot)|phb|10-foot-pole}, 50 feet of {@item Hempen Rope (50 feet)|phb|rope}, {@item waterskin|phb}, {@item rations (1 day)|phb|rations} (4 days), {@item steel mirror|phb}

{@item Backpack|phb}, 4 {@item sack|phb|sacks}, {@item holy symbol|phb} or {@item thieves' tools|phb}, 12 {@item piton|phb|pitons}, 50 feet of {@item Hempen Rope (50 feet)|phb|rope}, {@item waterskin|phb}, {@item rations (1 day)|phb|rations} (4 days)

entries: All characters also gain a dagger and either a {@item light crossbow|phb} and 10 {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|bolts}, or a set of 5 {@item javelin|phb|javelins}.

entries.name: Cleric Spells
entries: Randomly determining spells can speed up the process of creating a 1st-level cleric.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Roll a {@dice d6} three times to determine your cleric cantrips, rerolling any duplicate results.

entries.name: Spells
entries: Roll a {@dice d10} for each cleric spell you can prepare, rerolling any duplicate results.

entries.name: Fighter Fighting Style
entries: Roll a {@dice d6} to determine your fighting style, and make the indicated adjustments if you selected the default equipment package.

rows: {@optfeature Archery} (swap {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts} for a {@item longbow|phb} and {@item Arrows (20)|PHB|20 arrows}; at your option, also swap {@item chain mail|phb} for {@item leather armor|phb})
{@optfeature Great Weapon Fighting} (swap {@item longsword|phb} and {@item shield|phb} for a {@item greataxe|phb})
{@optfeature Two-Weapon Fighting} (swap {@item longsword|phb} for two {@item shortsword|PHB|short swords})

entries.name: Rogue Proficiencies
entries: Roll a {@dice d12} four times to determine your skills, rerolling any duplicate results. In addition, reroll any results that duplicate skills granted by your background.

entries.name: Wizard Spells
entries: Randomly determining spells can speed up the process of creating a 1st-level wizard.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Roll a {@dice d10} three times to determine your wizard cantrips, rerolling any duplicate results.

entries.name: Spells
entries: Roll a {@dice d12} six times to determine the contents of your wizard spellbook, rerolling any duplicate results.

entries.name: Race
entries: Finally, roll a {@dice d12} to determine your character's race. The following table is weighted heavily toward humans, both to reflect typical D&D demographics and to push players toward the easiest option.
